results.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, John Foreman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Prime western with warmth and great humour about the exploits of one of the last great bands of outlaws since Jesse James. Butch Cassidy and the deadly Sundance Kid are the most likeable outlaws in the West and amongst the most successful until their most ingenious caper, a round-trip train robbery, backfires, putting the west’s most relentless bounty hunters on their trail. Butch and the Kid use all their wiles to avoid capture, and finally elude their posse by making a hair-raising hundred foot jump into a raging mountain stream. Headed for Bolivia, the outlaws continue to rob banks until they meet their destiny. Stars Paul Newman, Robert Redford and Katharine Ross.

results.title: But you're a girl
results.creator_credit: Sue Johnston, Julie Ruth and Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: Shows some of the areas girls have traditionally worked in are no longer certain providers of jobs and then goes on to look at other job options such as trades, apprenticeships and traditionally male dominated professions. Indicates that is is possible for girls and young women to enter these areas, do well in them and enjoy them.

results.title: But what about spelling?
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan, Julie Shepherd, Chris Tibballs and Materials Production Dandenong School Support Centre
results.brief_description: A video to assist teachers with the development of balanced spelling programs. Spelling is seen as a problem solving process and the focus is on strategies for learning to spell within context rather than on rote learning of words.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vincent Donovan, Julie Shepherd, Chris Tibballs and Materials Production Dandenong School Support Centre

results.title: But names will never hurt
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: An English/Canadian boy comes to realise how prejudice affects everyone involved. Designed to help 8-10 year olds understand and cope with their emotions

results.title: But I'm a Cheerleader
results.brief_description: Megan is an all-American girl. A cheerleader. She has a boyfriend. But Megan doesn’t like kissing her boyfriend very much. And she’s pretty touchy with her cheerleader friends. Her conservative parents worry that she must be a lesbian and send her off to “sexual redirection” school, where she must, with other lesbians and gays learn how to be straight.

constellations_other.name: Thomas Edison
constellations_other.description: Thomas Edison helped establish cinema as an art-form and mass entertainment. Many of his early films were short and showed everyday activities like riding a bicycle.

results.title: But I'm a cheerleader
results.creator_credit: Jamie Babbit, Leanna Creel, Andrea Sperling, HKM Films, The Kusher-Locke Company, Ignite Entertainment and Franchise Pictures
results.brief_description: Paying a large debt to the films of John Waters, “But I’m a cheerleader” takes a satiric look at teenage sexuality through the experience of Megan (Natasha Lyonne), whose parents believe her to be a lesbian. Based on very superficial evidence Peter and Nancy panic at the very thought and pack their daughter off to True Directions, a camp designed to realign teenagers’ homosexual urges to the heterosexual team. At camp a group of disgruntled teens study role assignation tasks and behavioural patterns that will allow them to fit neatly into the world of white picket fences where their parents reside. This film delights in a sense of the absurd and relishes an excessively lurid palate, with colour-coded outfits and Barbie flavoured sets. Drag queen RuPaul is a bright spot as a straight camp teacher and John Waters’ regular Mink Stole plays Megan’s repressed mother but to score comically this film consistently draws on hysterical gay and straight stereotypes. Undoubtedly “But I’m a cheerleader” has an agenda regarding homophobia and teenage sexuality and at the same time is a lot of fun but it’s pleasures are principally aesthetic and fairly fleeting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jamie Babbit, Leanna Creel, Andrea Sperling, HKM Films, The Kusher-Locke Company, Ignite Entertainment and Franchise Pictures

results.creator_credit: Yale Marc, Jim Herzig and Action for Children's Television
results.brief_description: Presents an analysis of commercial television programs for children, with excerpts from shows and commercials. Includes comments from professionals working with children and reactions from children.

results.title: Busy hands
results.creator_credit: A Bhaskarrao, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film shows villagers as they attend cottage industries classes held in their communities in which families learn weaving, rope making, tailoring, tanning and leather work, pottery and other useful trades. NB: Print unable to be screened due to shrinkage.

results.title: Busy bodies
results.brief_description: Discusses how exercise and movement contribute to good health and physical condition. Shows characteristic movement of a variety of animals, followed by children imitating those movements. Narrated by Vic Perrin. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.
